newsitem.title: UK: UK April oil output down for fourth month-newslett.
newsitem.headline: UK April oil output down for fourth month-newslett.

text.p: British oil production fell for the fourth month in succession in April as several platforms underwent planned maintenance work, industry newsletter Aberdeen Petroleum Report (APR) said on Wednesday.
U.K. crude and natural gas liquids output in April fell to 2.485 million barrels a day (bpd) down 107,000 bpd from 2.592 million in March, APRs survey of North Sea operators found.
Production was 256,000 bpd below a recent high set in December at 2.741 million. Output fell to 2.608 million in February.
Average output from the Brent field fell to 115,000 bpd from 169,000 bpd in March as the Brent Delta platfrom was taken out of commission as part of a long-term redevelopment programme.
Other fields registering lower supply in April included British Petroleum's Miller, Enterprise's Nelson and Amerada Hess' Scott/Telford.
April figures reflected the first full month of production from Texaco's new Captain field (25,000 bpd) and first data from Phillips' J-Block which came on stream on April 21 (9,600 bpd).
